text:
I listen DOMNodeInsertedIntoDocument and DOMNodeRemovedFromDocument mutation 
events in a document where every node is listening for these events.
With such a call : parent.removeChild(child), all children (and subtree) of 
parent will receive a notification DOMNodeRemovedFromDocument with themselve as 
EventTarget witch is not correct because siblings of child won't be removed.
When we handle these events, there's no way to stop propagation because the 
flag stopPropagation is initialized to false in the method dispatchEvent 
(DocumentImpl).
Is it a misunderstanding or a bug ?
